text: some people tell me they don't know how
even to start a crossword and my
recommendation always is start with a
Monday puzzle because that's the easiest
one of the week start with what you know
for sure and put that in usually the
easiest clues to solve or the ones with
fill in the blanks because they're easy
to spot in the list of clues and they
often have unique answers wherever you
start maybe it's a bit of trivia maybe
it's a definition that has only one
possible answer fill in what you know
for sure and build out from there always
keep in mind that a clue and an answer
will have the same meeting and be in the
same part of speech and will be
interchangeable in a sentence with the
same meaning
so if the clue is blue you're not
looking for something that is blue
you're looking for a synonym for blue
could be sad could be something about
could be a sure as in the color but keep
in mind it's always the same part of
speech if you were completely stumped by
a puzzle a technique that often works is
to put it aside and come back later if
you can get just one more answer that
may be enough to break the logjam and
get you often going again
you
